Well strictly referring to swap logic, for me I like to swap in ways that give the illusion of panic, because some players are so eager to maintain advantage they can get played. 

Like if I swap to a counter after I’m countered, they have swap advantage and I’m still cooked. 

But if I swap to something - say I had a Mud Slapper and Azu against your Weezing, I would go Azu because if I lost the lead matchup hard enough, you might swap Weezing out simply to preserve the counter for my lead, but my real option to kill it is still in the back. So I now know my Mud Slapper has a great matchup in the back, and I can play shields accordingly to try and trap it later. 

(Morpeko-Azu-Altaria also isn’t really an ABA team, they don’t share a type at all?)

An [autowalker](https://www.amazon.ca/phone-swing/s?k=phone+swing&tag=namespaceca125-20) is a device you insert your phone into, and it swings in a way that tricks your health app into counting steps.
